author: JOHN BREEDEN Daily News-Record
title: Harrisonburg's Ava Colley thriving as football program's first girl player | Harrisonburg | dnronline.com
text:
Ava Colley’s football journey began with watching games on television and playing the sport on the weekends with her dad.
That quality time with her father, David, was always fun for Ava, and she enjoyed football so much that she decided to take it to the next level and play competitively growing up.
Football has always been male-dominated, and Colley wanted to prove otherwise.
“Eventually, it just led to me wanting to prove that girls can play a sport,” Colley said. “Even if it isn’t meant for them.”
Colley started her football career in recreational leagues, but when she reached eighth grade, she was told eighth graders weren’t allowed to play at the rec level.
Colley had only one option — high school football.
“I was like, ‘Well, I’m not going to give up my dream of playing football,’” Colley said. “So, I came up to the high school level, played [junior varsity], and I loved it — so I continued to play.”
Sure enough, through hard work and dedication to the sport that she loves, Colley, now a sophomore, has earned herself a spot as the long snapper on the Harrisonburg varsity football squad — the first girl football player for the Blue Streaks in program history.
“When you can be the first to do anything, as long as it’s something good, it’s gotta be important,” HHS head coach Kyle Gillenwater said. “I know she put all the hours in and the sweat and everything to do it. She deserves an opportunity, and she’ll get one.”
Colley isn’t phased by being the only girl on a team.
She embraces it.
“At this point, it’s just second nature,” Colley said. “I’ve done it my whole life since I could play tackle football. It’s just something that I love to do. I love my teammates. They accept me for it, and they help me whenever I need it.”
Of course, it’s somewhat of a different dynamic among her teammates when talking to her compared to each other. Still, the camaraderie is there as Colley feels she’s treated no differently than any other player.
“They still help me,” Colley said. “We still have good laughs and all that. It’s just something fun that we get to do, and it’s just a different experience for them. I think they enjoy having a different perspective of football.”
Being a long snapper is something Colley made herself into, Gillenwater said, adding that when she started this venture, she hadn’t been in the weight room much and wanted to take on a skill where it didn’t matter as much.
Ever since taking the position, Colley has thrived.
“She snapped every day for about a year and a half, and she’s gotten pretty good at it,” Gillenwater said. “It was a skill she worked really hard to attain, and that’s how all that came to be.”
Gillenwater has welcomed Colley to the program with open arms.
From day one, Colley said Gillenwater has been widely accessible, helping her with anything she needs and giving her a chance to showcase her talent.
“He’s been really helpful this year,” Colley said. “He’s helped me take on more positions and given me the opportunities that he would the rest of the team, so that’s been nice. He’s given me the chance to go in the weight room during the offseason workouts so I can keep up with everyone else.”
A former captain on the junior varsity team, Gillenwater said that’s translated to the varsity level as Colley is a leader and sets a quality example of how a player should conduct themselves.
“She’s at everything we have — first one there, last one to leave,” Gillenwater said. “Effort is always there. She’s the ultimate teammate.”
You can’t replace people who don’t miss anything, Gillenwater said.
That’s the case with Colley, as Gillenwater said she’s well aware of everything going on with the HHS offense and could answer any question about it.
At times, Colley’s knowledge of the game has morphed her into an extension of the Streaks coaching staff.
“She’s an additional coach on the field,” Gillenwater said. “There’s not much about what we do offensively that she doesn’t know. She studied that just like how she’s made herself a good player and a good long snapper.”
There’s no doubt Colley’s passion for football runs deep, and Gillenwater has seen it firsthand.
It’s evident to the dual-sport head coach how badly Colley wants to be a part of the Streaks program, and she’s rightfully earned the opportunity.
“From the first time that I’ve met her, she’s had a goal to do this,” Gillenwater said. “She worked extremely hard to get there. When you get a player like that, you’ve got to love having them on the team and be a part of the program.”
Colley is a proven example of how you can be anything you want if you put your mind to it.
Since those first days of seeing football on TV with her dad, Colley has put her mind towards football, and it’s paid off as she now takes the field alongside her Blue Streak teammates.
Now, Colley hopes her story will help pave the way for more girls to get opportunities in the sport, adding that if they saw what she did, they could have it in their minds that they can do it, too.
“That’s my ultimate goal of high school,” Colley said. “At least get some girls to believe in themselves that they can eventually end up coming up here and doing the same thing as me.”

author: @FOX10News
title: Warm shelter set up in Theodore to shield people without housing from this week’s bitter weather
text: Warm shelter set up in Theodore to shield people without housing from this week’s bitter weather It’s more than just a place to sleep. Meals, clothing, shoes and even healthcare will be on standby. MOBILE, Ala. ( [WALA](https://www.fox10tv.com/))- As temperatures drop dangerously low across the country, Eric Overstreet and John Kozlinski are ensuring people in the Mobile area have a warm place to stay. Both Overstreet and Kozlinski help folks who are displaced in the Mobile area. “This is a situation where they would maybe die on the street,” said Overstreet. “Last year, we opened five different shelters in churches and then we had the shelter downtown, the Samaritan’s home. This year, we decided to bring everybody to one place. The amazing Joey McCollough allowed us to use this gym.” The operation came together in just a few days, thanks to hundreds of volunteers who converted the gym at Theodore Church of God into a life-saving shelter. It’s more than just a place to sleep. Meals, desserts, clothing, shoes and even healthcare will be on standby. “This is an environment where they’re just going to be loved. We’re going to have three awesome meals a day, hot breakfast, lunch and dinner, amazing amounts of goodies and snacks and we’re going to treat them like family,” said Kozlinski. Just two days ago, they lost their friend, James, to hypothermia. James stayed at their warm shelter last year. “James was amazing, a brilliant guy. He had a master’s--- he was a sharp guy, we loved on him. He was an alcoholic, he just happened to be outside a couple nights ago when he got hypothermia and died in front of the Starbucks at Midtown,” said Overstreet. With his tragic death fresh on their minds, Overstreet and Kozlinski understand safety in the bitter cold is paramount. “We want to treat every human being like they’re created in God’s image, so everybody is the same to us,” said Overstreet. It was a touching scene Saturday afternoon. A steady stream of vehicles dropped off coats, blankets and shoes. “I’m just amazed- blown away by the fact that so many people are showing up to be a part of this. Anybody that wants to come by and serve-- if they’ll just stop by and talk to one of the team leaders here, they’ll get ‘em hooked up,” said Joey McCollough, Pastor at Theodore Church of God. We asked volunteers why they chose to step up to help. “No matter what they’ve been through, they don’t deserve to be out on the streets when it’s this cold,” said one. “It’s unreal. I can’t describe what it means- we did it last year. We had a lot of donations but nothing like this,” added another. “It’s very encouraging for me and my faith. And not only that-- but in humanity. To see humanity come together to help other people who are not in the best place they could be- to me, homeless people a lot of the times are just in transition,” said Ronald Stafford with Revive Ministries. Copyright 2024 WALA. All rights reserved.

author: F. Q.
title: Salvini sfida i sindacati: \u201cGi\u00e0 15 scioperi proclamati a dicembre, pronto a intervenire\u201d
text:
Matteo Salvini sfida i sindacati. Nel day after dello sciopero generale , il ministro delle Infrastrutture rivendica di aver firmato la precettazione: “Sono soddisfatto di aver garantito, ieri, il diritto a viaggiare con i mezzi pubblici a milioni di italiani”. Poi il leader della Lega provoca le parti sociali: “Il mio impegno non cambia in vista di dicembre, quando si contano già 15 scioperi proclamati , fra cui uno generale fissato il 13 (guarda caso un altro venerdì) a pochi giorni dal Natale . Sono pronto a intervenire ancora, per aiutare i cittadini”, dice il vice della presidente del consiglio Giorgia Meloni .
Dunque Salvini annuncia nuove precettazioni , dopo quella che ieri ha ridotto lo stop del settore trasporti a sole 4 ore: le linee di bus e metro sono rimaste chiuse nella fascia tra le 9 e le 13 in alcune fermate. La precettazione è stata aspramente criticata dai leader di Cgil e Uil , Maurizio Landini e Pierpaolo Bombardieri . “C’è una svolta autoritaria, contro la quale più di 500mila persone in tutta Italia hanno scelto di essere in piazza”, ha detto il primo, accusato dal governo di istigare alla rivolta sociale. “Noi vogliamo rivoltare come un guanto questo Paese “, ha detto Landini spiegando che la rivolta sociale significa “non voltarsi dall’altra parte di fronte alle ingiustizie, ma mettersi insieme” per cambiare la situazione.
Leggi Anche Sciopero, Tar respinge il ricorso dei sindacati contro la precettazione di Salvini nei trasporti. Ma l’annuncio del ministero diventa un caso Oggi il leader della Cgil ritorna sulle suo parole. “Quando sono stato a Palazzo Chigi per la legge di bilancio ho regalato alla presidente del Consiglio L’uomo in rivolta di Albert Camus. Il senso di quel libro che fece grande rumore è rimettere al centro la libertà delle persone . Se la persona non si rivolta di fronte alle ingiustizie non esiste come persona, perché viene cancellato . Io l’ho pensata così”, ha spiegato al congresso nazionale delle Acli. “Oggi la messa in discussione della democrazia non la danno le persone in piazza per i propri diritti ma chi in Parlamento sta tentando di far passare un decreto che chiama sicurezza ma riduce le libertà e gli spazi delle persone”. E ancora, ha aggiunto: “Vedo il rischio che di fronte” alle “diseguaglianze, anziché reagire, uno si rassegni che prevalga la paura , che prevalga la chiusura di ognuno pensando che da soli se lo deve risolvere. Ecco, io penso che proprio perché questa è la situazione, e proprio perché dall’altra parte oggi abbiamo un governo che sta agendo dal mio punto di vista proprio per mettere in discussione le organizzazioni sociali di rappresentanza , perché non vuole governare riconoscendo un ruolo di mediazione sociale ai vari soggetti di rappresentanza, ma pensa di poter comandare senza bisogno di dover mediare come dovrebbe fare qualsiasi governo anche con i soggetti sociali che hanno una rappresentanza, penso che di fronte a tutto questo ci sia bisogno che le persone di fronte alle ingiustizie , di fronte a quello che sta succedendo non si voltino da un’altra parte, ma che ognuno si rivolti di fronte a questa ingiustizia, si metta insieme agli altri anche con solidarietà per cambiare sostanzialmente questa situazione”. E a proposito dello sciopero di ieri, ha commentato: “Quello che arrivava dalle piazze era la volontà delle persone di esserci e di partecipare. Da quelle piazze arriva una domanda trasversale di partecipazione e di rappresentanza perché il livello di sfruttamento e di impoverimento sociale non è più accettabile e la gente vuole reagire. E’ importantissimo offrire un terreno di iniziativa che sia in grado di cogliere questo”.

author: Collinvyxwu Ampedpages Com
title: Best Endocrinologist in Texas: Acknowledged Know-how in Hormonal Medication
text:
Browsing the Complexities of Thyroid Disorders With an Endocrinologist
In this post, we will certainly check out the relevance of looking for specialist assistance from an endocrinologist when dealing with thyroid problems. We will certainly delve into the understanding of various thyroid disorders, the significance of accurate diagnosis, and the available therapy alternatives. Additionally, we will review the recurring monitoring and assistance required for individuals with thyroid conditions.
Recognizing Thyroid Problems
Thyroid problems can be better comprehended with assistance from an endocrinologist. The thyroid gland, situated in the neck, generates hormonal agents that control numerous physical functions. When this gland becomes underactive or overactive, it can cause an array of disorders. Hypothyroidism, for instance, occurs when the thyroid does not produce adequate hormones, causing symptoms such as tiredness, weight gain, and clinical depression. On the various other hand, hyperthyroidism happens when the thyroid produces an extra of hormones, resulting in symptoms like weight-loss, quick heartbeat, and anxiousness.
Comprehending thyroid conditions needs a detailed exam of a client's clinical background, physical exam, and lab tests. Endocrinologists specialize in the medical diagnosis and therapy of hormone disorders, including thyroid conditions.
Additionally, endocrinologists are acquainted with the latest improvements in thyroid research study, which enables them to provide one of the most updated and effective therapy strategies. Texas endocrinology. They can recommend medicine to manage hormone degrees, suggest way of living adjustments, and offer assistance on managing signs and symptoms. In even more complex instances, they may collaborate with various other specialists to make certain thorough treatment
Significance of an Endocrinologist
An endocrinologist plays an essential role in the medical diagnosis and monitoring of thyroid disorders, offering specialized knowledge and understanding in hormonal disorders. With their substantial training in the endocrine system, these clinical specialists are distinctively certified to examine and treat thyroid problems.
One of the crucial reasons that an endocrinologist is necessary in the monitoring of thyroid conditions is their capability to accurately identify the condition. Thyroid problems can be complicated, with symptoms that may overlap with various other clinical conditions. An endocrinologist has the competence to perform an extensive evaluation, including a detailed case history, health examination, and specialized examinations to properly diagnose the particular thyroid condition.
In addition, an endocrinologist is equipped to establish a tailored therapy strategy for each specific client. They take right into account factors such as the type and severity of the thyroid condition, the person's overall health and wellness, and their preferences. This tailored technique guarantees that the therapy strategy is maximized for the patient's particular needs, causing better results.
Along with diagnosis and treatment, an endocrinologist likewise plays a vital role in lasting administration of thyroid conditions. They check the client's thyroid hormone degrees, change medication does if essential, and offer recurring support and education to help people efficiently manage their condition.
Diagnosing Thyroid Disorders
The endocrinologist's know-how includes precisely detecting thyroid problems via a thorough evaluation, consisting of a thorough medical history, physical exam, and specialized examinations (Endocrinologist in leander). This method permits the endocrinologist to gather vital details about the person's signs, medical history, and household history, which can provide beneficial insights into the potential reasons of the thyroid disorder
During the physical exam, the endocrinologist will thoroughly analyze the person's neck for any kind of indications of swelling or irregularity in the thyroid gland. They may likewise inspect for other physical indicators, such as
wikipedia referencemodifications in hair structure, skin dryness, or extending eyes, which can be a sign of thyroid conditions.
Along with the medical history and checkup, the endocrinologist may get customized tests to further evaluate the feature of the thyroid gland. These tests might consist of blood tests to gauge the levels of thyroid hormonal agents, thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), and antibodies that may be connected with autoimmune thyroid problems. Imaging tests, such as ultrasound or nuclear medication scans, may additionally be executed to assess the dimension, form, and structure of the thyroid gland.
Treatment Alternatives and Administration
The option of treatment depends on the certain type and intensity of the thyroid problem, as well as individual person variables. In instances of hypothyroidism, where the thyroid gland does not generate sufficient thyroid hormonal agents, the most typical treatment is hormonal agent replacement treatment.
For hyperthyroidism, where the thyroid gland produces too much amounts of thyroid hormones, therapy choices consist of medications, radioactive iodine therapy, or surgical treatment. Drugs, such as beta blockers, can be prescribed to handle symptoms and minimize the production of thyroid hormonal agents. Contaminated iodine therapy includes taking a contaminated compound that is selectively soaked up by the overactive thyroid cells, damaging them. Surgical treatment might be advised in certain cases, such as when there are nodules or growths present in the thyroid gland.
Along with these traditional treatments, there are likewise different therapies that some individuals may think about, such as herbal supplements, acupuncture, or dietary changes. It is important to keep in mind that these alternate treatments ought to be discussed with an endocrinologist to guarantee they are reliable and safe.
Long-Term Care and Support
Long-lasting treatment and assistance for people with thyroid conditions entails continuous surveillance and tailored treatment intends supplied by an endocrinologist. After a preliminary medical
next pagediagnosis and treatment, it is essential for clients to proceed getting normal follow-up treatment to make sure that their thyroid function stays steady which any kind of possible issues are determined and attended to quickly.
Normal surveillance of thyroid hormone levels via blood tests permits the endocrinologist to assess the efficiency of the therapy strategy and make any necessary changes. This close tracking additionally allows the early discovery of any changes in thyroid function and the recognition of prospective regressions or problems, such as the advancement of nodules or the progression of thyroid cancer. Depending on the details demands of the client, monitoring may take place every couple of months or on an annual basis.
Final Thought
With their understanding and experience, endocrinologists can offer lasting treatment and support to people with thyroid conditions. By seeking the guidance of an endocrinologist, people can get the needed care and management to effectively browse their thyroid condition. Best endocrinologist in texas.
visit our websiteinstances of hypothyroidism, where the thyroid gland does not generate enough thyroid hormones, the most common therapy is hormone substitute treatment.For hyperthyroidism, where the thyroid gland produces too much quantities of thyroid hormones, therapy choices consist of medicines, contaminated iodine treatment, or surgical procedure.In addition to monitoring thyroid hormonal agent degrees, long-lasting care for people with thyroid disorders also entails taking care of any kind of signs and symptoms that may emerge.
